item.title: Multiple buttons on header, with a popup email form
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

Continuing the discussion from Banner images cut off :/:

Kate:

I have a project coming up that I have a question for you on…
I am using the Bryant template for a client site. Can you add in multiple buttons on the header image instead of just the one that I can achieve using the site description box?

If so, what would be the cost to have 4 buttons across the header? Could you make this happen with CSS?

Kate:

I am wondering what the cost would be for you to add in 3 buttons on the header of the bryant template that have the ability to “pop up” with a form that says “coming soon” and have a space to leave an email address?

Oh boy. This is not good. I'm afraid it'd be more expensive than (I guess) anyone would be willing to pay.

All that sounds to me way more complicated than they should. I mean, I I were a squarespace customer who knows nothing about programming or how websites are built, I can easily see how frustrating this can look. "How come we can do all that on the page, but not on the title?" I would ask myself. It's quite an unfortunate limitation indeed! Except maybe for the popup, that is not really provided.

In any case...

Adding a popup message is simple enough, I've done it before. "Building" a form inside it to leave an email addres is much more complex and not so trivial, although it's also not too hard to do. The tricky part is how to add content, like with the video banner. The same for making the 4 buttons across the header.

The total cost would be U$444.

Posts: 3

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Multiple buttons on header, with a popup email form

item.title: Squarespace Help such as Centering Logo and Reducing Spaces
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Hi! I run a small web design company using Squarespace templates and found
you when looking for Squarespace specialists.

I am looking for a developer who can help me institute features that aren't
standard on Squarespace templates. For example, 2 things I'd like help
with are:

+ How to center the logo in the Bedford template, with page links on either
side, like the Pacific Template http://pacific-demo.squarespace.com.

+How to reduce spaces between images, so they can be closer together, like
the social media icons attached below. (The first image is the site, and
the second is how I'd like the social media icons arranged. Squarespace
automatically pads the images so you can't get them closer to each other
and I need to find a way around this.)

Are you available to take on this kind of work?

Ideally, it would be a working relationship where I could use your
development expertise, and occasionally even refer you clients for more
complicated projects.

Thank you so much and hope to hear from you!

Courtney

Screen Shot 2015-04-29 at 1.36.37 PM.png1705x1092 1010 KB

Screen Shot 2015-04-28 at 6.28.26 PM.png1063x220 581 KB

item.title: Help with making my website's calendar alive while keeping it good lookin'
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

kajmak@gmail.com:

Hi Cregox,

Squarespace have directed me to their list of Specialists to address following inquiry…

Obviously I have a website on the Squarespace platform and the aesthetics is what brought me to it. The website is about a holiday house rental on the Croatian coast I’ve renovated and redesigned. The whole project has a specific aesthetics and design and I wanted the website to follow it up.

I am saying all this because my question to you is about the calendar on the website. The way it looks is how I would like to have it in the future as well. I don’t need a proper book it yourself interactive calendar since I want to have a chat with all of our future guests. The “only” thing what I would like to change is that the calendar is within the website. At the moment, it is a vector file in Illustrator and with every booking that is being made I export new bitmap image and upload it. Its also not a major work but I would love if in the future somebody else can run the whole booking process and the website without me around. So, my question for you is if it is possible to program my calendar to become some sort of add on or application within my website’s Squarespace control pages. All I want this calendar to be able to do is: to be able to load a new year when the time comes, to be able to individually delete the booked dates, to be able to bring back already deleted dates in the case of cancelled bookings. That’s about it.
Obviously the most important thing for you first is to see what am I talking about… There it is the website:

kucakamena.com http://kucakamena.com/

… and the calendar page:

kucakamena.com/availability/ http://kucakamena.com/availability/

The Squarespace have already said it would be possible to implement something like that into the theme.

I am looking forward hearing back from you with your opinion about my inquiry, or even better price straight away..

Kind regards

Boris Kajmak

Posts: 6

Participants: 3

Read full topic
item.source: Help with making my website's calendar alive while keeping it good lookin'

item.title: Adding gift card support on squarespace, rather than coupons
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

janis@may28th.me:

Hey there,
I found you listed as developers for squarespace and wanted to see if you
would have any interest in helping us out. We have an online store looking
for a solution to have gift card support in squarespace.

As you might know squarespace only has coupon support and a true gift card
functionality is not available. Do you have any ideas how to have a
workaround that would support :
- checkout with a unique coupon that covers price of product and shipping.
i.e. 39+5$
- automated way of selling a gift card on the same store, so no manual
labor is needed.

Cheers and let me know your thoughts on this and possible timeline/pricing.

item.title: Remove any image click / link / lightbox from gallery page
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

no-reply@squarespace.com:

Name: Tjaart Lehmacher

Email Address: tjaart@helpingbrands.care

Subject: Custom coding assistance with a Squarespace site required, please

Message: Caue,

As you can see from this email's subject I'm in need of some custom CSS
support and here's hoping you will be able to come to my aid.

I have chosen the Wexley template for my Squarespace site and there's a
couple of changes I would like to make on this template however I don't
have ANY coding experience whatsoever. I've asked the following question on
the Squarespace Answers forum with no luck so far and I'm amazed that no
one their can support me with this because I don't feel that this one
change presents itself as a worthy challenge for someone to resolve with
CSS knowledge.

Anyway, here's the one question:

How do I disable the lightbox slideshow feature in the Wexley template's
gallery grid with custom CSS?

In other words one would NOT be able to click on any image (b/w teen
photos) in the gallery grid (to open a lightbox slideshow) I want the
images on the home page's gallery to display as is in the grid only without
them being clickable – I want the images to display-only WITHOUT the
clickthrough to the lightbox.

My site's URL (which is still a work-in-progress): helpingbrands.care

On the forum I was able to find some code suggestions similar to my
predicament which I had to customise somewhat to fit my site however with
no coding knowledge, no luck was on the horizon. Have a look at:

http://answers.squarespace.com/questions/70489/remove-the-gallery-links-in-a-summary-block

And:

http://answers.squarespace.com/questions/35218/disable-grid-views-lightbox

Anyway, here's hoping you can help me.

With optimism.
Tjaart L.

PS. There could be more custom CSS I might require with this site and I
have no problem remunerating you for your time.

(Sent via cregox http://www.cregox.com )

Posts: 10

Participants: 4

Read full topic

item.title: Animated GIFs versus videos on background
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

Continuing the discussion from Using a gallery instead of the template banner:

Kate:

what would it take to get a longer loop on my new GIF banner? Right now I can only upload a 5 second GIF to SS it seems- anything larger than that gets cut off.
https://kate-bosse-1pyu.squarespace.com

Would love to know what you would think of for a solution

Kate:

You think there's any way around it? Would it be worth trying javascript to tell the browser to replace these gifs with new ones every 5 seconds after preloading them, so it looks seamless to add in more?

I can't think of any good way that would be worth the trouble.

Squarespace limits images to 20mb, even if GIFs could be much bigger.

For your actually pretty good idea, you'd need at least 2 complicated things done:

  • Script to precisely change one gif for another. It might be quite hard to sync and it can easily lose sync because there's no control over the gif playback.
  • Make the many GIFs properly synced. You probably have the files in video format first.

Maybe the best bet if you want to insist on going GIF would be using a smaller size, even much smaller than 320x200

Meanwhile...

When using a video there's no sync needed and no gif making process. And the script to use the video is also much simpler than a script to properly and quickly change gifs with precision.

I'd say the only real downside on going video is uploading it to vimeo, youtube or some good streaming service.

Kate:

could you tell me the cost to put up a video instead?

That's generally a tricky question. It could be as simple as less than 1h and just adding this script:

<div style="position: fixed; z-index: 1000; width: 100%; height: 100%">
<iframe frameborder="0" height="100%" width="100%" 
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/aQsy17K84Ls?
autoplay=1&controls=0&showinfo=0&autohide=1">
</iframe>
</div>

Or quite complicated, while still being less than 2 hours, such as adding it as a full background with a text overlay on top, as seen in gravity or the one you had for instance.

And then for costs, you know the drill. As I promised you, I can keep ya on the old table up to April 18th. Summing it up, it should cost no more than U$ 84.

Posts: 17

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Animated GIFs versus videos on background

item.title: Dynamic "contact box"
item.dc:creator: @tormartin tormartin
item.description:
@tormartin wrote:

Hi,

I have a special request from a client. He wants a "contact box" that appears after some seconds.
This box has two choices, "sell estate" and "buy estate". If the user presses either of them, the user is promoted to a new contact box based on prior selection.

"Sell estate" prompts name, address and some other contact information.
"Buy estate" prompts area you want to live in, price range and other information that is essential for this contact box.

This contact box should appear on all pages after some time, and would be a visual "call to action" button.

Is it possible and what is the cost estimate on such an asset.

Regards,
Tor Martin

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic

item.title: Using a gallery instead of the template banner
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

Hey @Kate, remember this list we agreed on making item 2?

  1. You want a picture or a video on top header? That should be U$ 42
  2. You want a gallery on top header? U$ 210
  3. You want a different gallery on top header for each page? U$ 294

Well, it so happened I had a different picture of what you wanted, and for what I now think you need it would be actually even simpler.

I was thinking on moving the gallery on top of the header, not the page banner. So, item 3 is moot and I'll probably finish early...

https://kate-bosse-87i3.squarespace.com/home-copied

Please do verify this is almost what you want and bring on what else you need to change there. I would only make its height automatically big enough so we can see the video controls (which already happens on screen width 640px).

I also still need to fix a few glitches I've noticed there... But it's almost ready already, as you hopefully could see there!

Posts: 31

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Using a gallery instead of the template banner
